title: Mark Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Mark with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 16 chapters.

questions.question: Who baptized Jesus in the river Jordan?
questions.explanation: Jesus was baptized by John the Baptist in the river Jordan as recorded in Mark 1:9.

questions.question: What did Jesus say to Simon and Andrew when he first called them?
options: Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men
Go and find the lost sheep
questions.correctAnswer: Follow me, and I will make you fishers of men
questions.explanation: Jesus called Simon and Andrew with the words 'Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.'

questions.question: How long was Jesus tempted in the wilderness?
questions.explanation: Jesus was in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan.

questions.question: In Mark 2, who did Jesus say had a right to heal on the Sabbath, the sick or the law?
questions.explanation: Jesus emphasized mercy over sacrifice, showing the importance of healing the sick even on the Sabbath.

questions.question: What miracle did Jesus perform for the man with the withered hand on the Sabbath?
options: He gave him a new hand
questions.explanation: Jesus healed the man’s withered hand despite the Sabbath controversy.

questions.question: Who were the sons of Zebedee that Jesus called to follow Him?
questions.explanation: James and John, sons of Zebedee, were called by Jesus to follow Him.

questions.question: What did Jesus do to the storm while on the boat with His disciples?
options: He rebuked the wind and said, Peace, be still
He told the disciples to row harder
questions.correctAnswer: He rebuked the wind and said, Peace, be still
questions.explanation: Jesus calmed the storm by commanding the wind and sea to be still.

questions.question: In the parable of the sower, what does the seed that fell on stony ground represent?
options: Those who hear the word and immediately receive it with gladness but have no root
Those who hear but Satan takes away the word
Those who hear but are choked by cares
Those who hear and bear fruit
questions.correctAnswer: Those who hear the word and immediately receive it with gladness but have no root
questions.explanation: The seed on stony ground represents those who initially receive the word joyfully but fall away when troubles arise.

questions.question: What is the mustard seed compared to in the kingdom of God parable?
options: A small seed that grows into the largest of all herbs
A tiny grain that never grows
A seed that is eaten by birds
A seed that falls among thorns
questions.correctAnswer: A small seed that grows into the largest of all herbs
questions.explanation: The mustard seed is used to illustrate how the kingdom of God starts small but grows large and expansive.

questions.question: What did Jesus say defiles a man, according to Mark 7?
options: What comes out of a man
questions.correctAnswer: What comes out of a man
questions.explanation: Jesus taught that evil thoughts and actions emerging from within defile a man, not external things like unwashed hands.

questions.question: Which prophet did Jesus quote when addressing the Pharisees' hypocrisy?
questions.explanation: Jesus quoted Isaiah to accuse the Pharisees of honoring God with lips but having hearts far from Him.

questions.question: Who was the woman that touched Jesus’ garment and was healed?
options: A woman with an issue of blood
questions.correctAnswer: A woman with an issue of blood
questions.explanation: A woman suffering from a bleeding issue touched Jesus’ clothes and was instantly healed.

questions.question: What did Jesus do when Jairus’ daughter had died?
options: He said she was only sleeping
He wept and then raised her
questions.correctAnswer: He said she was only sleeping
questions.explanation: Jesus told those mourning that the girl was sleeping and then raised her from the dead.

questions.question: Who was the first to see Jesus after His resurrection according to Mark 16?
questions.explanation: Mary Magdalene was the first to see the risen Jesus as He appeared to her.

questions.question: What did the angel say to the women at the tomb?
options: He is not here, he is risen
questions.correctAnswer: He is not here, he is risen
questions.explanation: The angel announced that Jesus had risen and was not in the tomb.

questions.question: What was Jesus’ instruction to His disciples after His resurrection?
options: Go into all the world and preach the gospel
questions.correctAnswer: Go into all the world and preach the gospel
questions.explanation: Jesus commanded His disciples to preach the gospel to all creation.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the people when Jesus healed the man possessed by an unclean spirit in the synagogue?
options: They were amazed and questioned His authority
questions.correctAnswer: They were amazed and questioned His authority
questions.explanation: People were astonished because Jesus taught with authority and commanded unclean spirits.

questions.question: According to Mark, what was the first title given to Jesus in the gospel?
questions.explanation: The gospel is introduced as the beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.

questions.question: What did Jesus do early in the morning before preaching in Galilee?
options: He prayed in a solitary place
questions.correctAnswer: He prayed in a solitary place
questions.explanation: Jesus rose early and went to a solitary place to pray.

questions.question: Who did Jesus heal that was sick with a fever in Mark 1?
questions.explanation: Jesus healed Simon Peter's mother-in-law of her fever.

questions.question: How did Jesus respond when the Pharisees questioned His disciples eating without washing their hands?
options: He rebuked the Pharisees for valuing tradition over God's commandments
He told His disciples to wash their hands
questions.correctAnswer: He rebuked the Pharisees for valuing tradition over God's commandments
questions.explanation: Jesus criticized the Pharisees for making the commandments of men more important than God's law.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the kingdom of God in the parable of the seed growing secretly?
options: It grows without the sower knowing how
It only grows when the sower watches
It does not grow at all
questions.correctAnswer: It grows without the sower knowing how
questions.explanation: The seed grows by itself, the man does not understand how, illustrating the mysterious growth of God's kingdom.

questions.question: What did the disciples do when Jesus healed the deaf and dumb man?
options: They were astonished and told no one
questions.correctAnswer: They were astonished and told no one
questions.explanation: Jesus charged them not to tell anyone, but they were greatly astonished.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus commanded the unclean spirits to speak and reveal His identity freely.
questions.explanation: Jesus often forbade unclean spirits to speak because they knew who He was.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus healed a leper who came kneeling to Him and asking to be made clean.
questions.explanation: Jesus healed the leper who humbly sought Him.

questions.question: True or False: The parable of the sower teaches that all who hear the word will bear fruit.
questions.explanation: The parable shows different responses to the word; not all bear fruit.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus sent out the twelve disciples two by two to preach and cast out devils.
questions.explanation: Jesus sent the twelve out in pairs to preach and heal.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus fed 5,000 men with five loaves and two fishes.
questions.explanation: Jesus miraculously fed 5,000 men with five loaves and two fishes.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus walked on water to meet His disciples in the boat during a storm.
questions.explanation: Jesus walked on the sea toward the disciples’ boat.

questions.question: True or False: The Pharisees welcomed Jesus’ teachings about the traditions of the elders gladly.
questions.explanation: The Pharisees often opposed Jesus because He challenged their traditions.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told the disciples that the Son of man must be betrayed and killed and rise again after three days.
questions.explanation: Jesus predicted His suffering, death, and resurrection.

questions.question: True or False: Peter confessed Jesus as the Christ, the Son of the living God.
questions.explanation: Peter declared Jesus to be the Christ, the Son of God.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus was transfigured on a high mountain before Peter, James, and John.
questions.explanation: Jesus was transfigured, appearing radiant and speaking with Moses and Elijah.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The sabbath was made for ___, and not ___ for the sabbath.'
questions.explanation: Jesus taught that the Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his ___?'
questions.explanation: Jesus taught the value of the soul over worldly gain.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to ___.'
questions.explanation: Jesus commanded to preach the gospel to every creature after His resurrection.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'He that hath ears to hear, let him ___.'
questions.explanation: Jesus often used this phrase to urge attentive listening.

questions.question: Who was the disciple that Jesus nicknamed 'Cephas' (Peter)?
questions.explanation: Jesus gave Simon the name Cephas, which means Peter.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the least in the kingdom of God?
options: That he is greater than all
That he is the least of all and servant of all
That he shall be cast out
questions.correctAnswer: That he is the least of all and servant of all
questions.explanation: Jesus taught humility and servanthood as keys to greatness in the kingdom.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say was the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?
options: One who humbles himself like a child
questions.correctAnswer: One who humbles himself like a child
questions.explanation: Jesus said to receive a child in His name is to receive Him and be greatest.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about causing little ones to stumble?
options: It would be better to have a millstone tied around one's neck and be cast into the sea
They should be taught with kindness
questions.correctAnswer: It would be better to have a millstone tied around one's neck and be cast into the sea
questions.explanation: Jesus strongly condemned causing little ones to sin.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about divorce in Mark 10?
options: That Moses permitted it because of hardness of heart
That it is not mentioned in the law
questions.correctAnswer: That Moses permitted it because of hardness of heart
questions.explanation: Jesus explained divorce was permitted due to hardness of heart but was not God's original intention.

questions.question: Who asked Jesus, 'Good Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?'
questions.explanation: A young ruler asked Jesus about inheriting eternal life.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.
questions.explanation: Jesus used this vivid image to teach about the difficulty for the rich to enter God's kingdom.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus healed a blind man named Bartimaeus at Jericho.
questions.explanation: Jesus restored the sight of Bartimaeus near Jericho.
